result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M Larson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James M Larson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for James M Larson.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

Defendant James M Larson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for James M Larson.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  A DPA has been offered to the defendant who has a TAD evaluation scheduled.  Parties request a status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant James M Larson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Steinle appeared by video for James M Larson.  
Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Steinle requests a plea and sentencing date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 080620,
Payable Number: 1027438,
Receipt Number: 22RP033780,
Amount: $20.00
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Officer Schwandt.

Defendant James M Larson in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/5/22 @ 2p
